title: Credit cards or foreign debit cards not accepted.
text: It is really a pity that after such a good meal that last experience I got from the night is a negative one. When paying I was told that they didn’t accept any credit card or any foreign debit cards. I had to leave the restaurant and look for a cash machine to get some money to pay my bill. In today’s world, this is something completely strange and not acceptable to me. The food was really great and an efficient service, but it ended in a disappointing way.

title: Try the Tangerine-Ginger flavor
text: Decided to try a strange flavor and when I saw the Tangerine-Ginger available, two things I love, that could only be my decision. It was a perfect blend of both flavours, just delicious. They have several other different flavours which allows for some interesting options. If you are in the area, give it a try.

title: Great service, food and place
text: Had dinner on a Tuesday night and the place has very few people. The service was very efficient, we didn’t have to wait too long for the food, and the waiter was extremely nice. The food itself was delicious, typical Greek one. For two adults we stayed with starters and for 3 kids we ordered two steaks which was more than enough for them. The place is really well decorated giving a very nice atmosphere. In all a very nice meal and time and not an expensive place. Definitely recommended.

title: Come down through the stairs
text: Amazing building. We started with a quick visit inside the church which is very beautiful with four different organs. Then we took the lift to the tower where you have a great 360 degrees view of the city. But the must to do is coming down from the top by the stairs. There are several stages with different information and details of the tower/church which you will miss if coming up and down through the lift. There is a fee of 6 € to go to the top of tower. Definitely recommended.

title: A great example of what war does
text: This is an historic place which is a great example of what war does to all of us. The church was destroyed in the Second World War by allies airplane bombings and the site was kept like it is to remind all war victims. You don’t need more than 15-20 minutes to walk around the site and read all the information around but is is a must see for its historic meaning. There is a lift to the top of the tower but I didn’t go up. Truly recommended.

title: Interesting piece of engineering
text: Very interesting walk across the tunnel. Not much to see on the other side but you can have a nice different view of Hamburg from the other side of the river. Make sure to try the big elevator. It won’t take you more than 30 min but I think it is well worth and for free.

title: Alternative pizza concept
text: What a great surprise when we entered. This is really an alternative place. You choose which ingredients you want on your pizza on top of the single base of tomato, mozzarella and olive oil. The pizza was delicious and the music excellent, so a place I would go back every day. Congratulations. Just check the toilets.

title: Ancient road in Athens and part of ancient wall
text: This was a very nice experience. Very few people in the site and a relax wandering around. Make sure you read all the instructions signs which clear describe what was build there. Highlights for me are the ancient road which was one of the main entrances to Athens and a small part of the ancient wall. We skipped the museum as we were in a hurry but still had a very good perspective of the site. Recommended.

title: Strange experience, with ok food but totally overpriced
text:
We were just wandering around in the port and chose this restaurant based on TA. It was around 13.15 when we got in and it was totally empty and the waiters seemed very surprised to see us. We had to ask twice if the restaurant was open as they didn’t react to our arrival. When we were looking at the menu and asking some queries there was some communication issues. Eventually we got there but the menu is not totally clear. For a Greek salad, a handful of steamed mussels, two fishes weighting 1,2 kg, one small dose of French fries, bread, and two beers, the bill came at a total of 165 euros. To pay such a value I would be expecting a much higher service and better food, a the food was just ok. I caught one of the male waiters staring at us at lest twice, not sure why, but this was weird.
By the way, there isn’t a single meat dish in the menu, only fish. I would not return back.

title: Just sit, enjoy the atmosphere and go back in time
text: One of my preferred places in the Acropolis site due to its atmosphere. As the theater is quite destroyed you really need to give your imagination some time. Therefore just sit and enjoy, take your time to really appreciate what is one of the vital locations of the entire site. Loved every second.

title: Best view is from the top inside the Acropolis
text: A quite imposing a ciente theatre. Best view is from the top already inside the Acropolis site, just before getting in the Acropolis. It is not possible to go inside. It seems quite well maintained as it seems like it is still used.

title: The highlight of Athens
text: An amazing experience which shall be experienced by all. We decided to use the East entrance which is the less crowded and take the ancient Peripatos Way which goes around the Acropolis. This was a great way to see the grandiosity of the place, so many different details that you will never be aware if you just go directly to the top. It is also like going really back in time and win your chance to enter the citadel above. Of course reaching the top and having the opportunity to learn so much about how this extraordinary place was in the past, it is definitely the highlight of any trip to Athens. No one should miss it.

title: Excellent linguine with shrimps
text: A really nice experience to have dinner here. Food was very good, specially the the linguine with shrimps which was exquisite. The desserts were also nice, but the lemon pie was quite sweet. Service formal and efficient as I like. Definitely recommended.

title: A great view and a great walk
text: This is definitely a place to go. The walk uphill was very nice even for the kids. It is kind of doing some easy hiking and the view from the top is really amazing. Not only to the Acropolis but also towards the sea. We were on top for around 20 minutes as it is really nice to sit and enjoy the view. On the way down don’t forget to check the Socrates Prison which is quite close.

title: Nice food but avoid the smoothies
text: Stopped here to have lunch before going up the hill to the Acropolis. We sat outside as the weather was very nice. The food is fine, nothing special but good enough. We tried the chicken and pork gyros pita, and the spaghetti bolognese. We ordered some smoothies which were very disappointing. I am ok with having a smoothie with frozen fruit but having it with half of water does not count as a smoothie for me. And paying 7 euros for each is definitely something I regret. Anyway, the service was efficient, and the location is great just close to the north entrance.

title: Great for kids and adults, but not cheap
text: Well, this is a place that for sure you will want to take a look if you are with kids. But it is also really nice for adults. The highlight is the decoration but the desserts are also at the same level. Be aware that the portions are quite big, therefore sharing is definitely something to think about. It is not cheap if you compare with other things in Greece. You can easily spend the same here for desserts than for a full lunch/dinner. But definitely recommend as an experience.

title: Take a look inside if you are aroung
text: It is a little bit hide but it definitely deserves a quick look inside. It is a very small church but quite charming. There was a wedding going on when we were going to the top of the hill but it was already possible to look inside when we were coming down. The building is quite interesting with some parts made of wood. It doesn’t take more than a few minutes to visit.

title: All food delicious and great service
text: I have to start saying that this has been so far our best meal in our three days in Athens. The place is really nice, the service was outstanding, mainly the lovely Irina who treated very well, and the most important thing, the food was delicious. The kids asked for a chicken souvlaki which is more than enough for 2 people. We also tried the Greek salad and the grilled vegetables with Haloumi and were both very good. Finally the moussaka was really tasty. I have to consider the price cheap for the service and food we got. The bread and tap water are free, and we even had three desserts for free. 45 euros for 5 people is really a great value. Well done and I definitely recommend it.

title: Don’t miss the public latrines!!!
text: It is part of the Ticket Package and definitely a place to spend some 20/30 minutes. Main places to take a look are the arch in the entrance, the tower of winds in the back of the site, and the public latrines on the right of the tower. This was the main market area in the Roman times and you need to use your imagination to think about this place which was for sure a crowded place. It is definitely about going back in time and an easy place for young kids to like and investigate as it is small and quick to visit. Definitely recommended.

title: Believe it or not, just go with the flow
text: On our way down from the top of the hill we checked the Prison of Socrates. There is not real evidence that Socrates was imprisoned here but it is always great to somehow believe and be part of history. Just imagining that one of the great man of our history could have been here makes it worth to go. Not much to see, you really need to use your imagination.

title: Historic place with a good Acropolis view
text: Coming down from the top of the hill we passed and spend some minutes at the Pnyx. The stage where people were talking is still visible but not many more around. The view to the Acropolis is another good one, but you will have better ones if you climb towards the top.

title: Tasty Fried food but not fresh seafood
text: First of all it is important manage some expectations. This is not a fresh seafood place, unless the definition is quite different than mine. The majority of the dishes available are fried, and served in a type of tapas small plates. We tried different dishes, the fried small shrimps and fried squids were delicious. The fried anchovies were good also, but the fried mussels were disappointing. The fried cod and chips was ok with big portion of fish. The service was efficient and quick and all in all a positive experience.

title: Delicious ice cream
text: Decided to try by chance and what a lucky ones we were. The ice cream was delicious, I tried the dark chocolate and the lemon mint flavors and both were so very tasty. There was a very small queue but the service is really fast and efficient. Only a handful of high chairs to sit so you really need to step out and eat outside. Definitely recommended.

title: Worth if you have the Package Ticket
text: It is a site that you can take a look in some 15/20 min. The columns are quite impressive, mainly the one knocked down, which clearly shows how they were built. The summer ticket is 8 euros and the off peak season half of the price, but in my opinion is only worth if you have the package ticket. There are some small ruins in the site from some Roman baths which are also interesting to take a look.

title: The most ancient dessert in the world
text: They say the lukumades are the ancient dessert in the world, that even Aristotle wrote about them. For me it is not the best in the world but definitely are a delicious one which I could probably eat several days a week. So many flavors to choose and try, and also a great way to share. Definitely recommended.

title: A true Greek experience
text: A kind of unique place, very small with almost no space to eat inside. There are some plastic chairs and table outside where we sat to eat our Souvlakis which were really delicious. The fries were very tasteful, a lot of salt and oregano, although on the cold side already. The experience of ordering inside, talking with the people that are cooking the meat, looking at the grill, was something special. Very few tourists and mainly locals taking away their food. Definitely recommended.

title: Probably the best fish soup I ever ate
text: Based on other reviews I decided to try this restaurant and it was a good experience. A great reception in the entrance and I was surprisingly taken to the basement, a very nice space. Got a beef carpaccio to start and a paella as a main dish, which were both ok, but the highlight was the fish soup, which was divinal. An attentive service resulted in a positive experience. Recommended.

title: An excellent early dinner
text: Decided to go for an early dinner around 17.30 and no surprising I was only one of two customers. Service was quite fast and the food was really delicious. Ordered a lamb curry dish with some garlic naan, and both were very tasty. As a starter I got a couple papadums, which were positively very different than any I have eaten before, and the samosas which were big and really good. A nice atmosphere and quiet which allowed for a very nice dinner and experience. Definitely recommended and a place to go back.

title: An overall nice experience
text: An interesting setting in a old manor with a nice decoration. There was only another table with people in the restaurant therefore it was quiet. We ordered some starters and Polvo à Lagareiro as a main dish. The starters were good but the Polvo (octopus) was average, a little bit overcooked and blend. The service was good and attentive, having suggested a very good wine. A good overall experience based on the company.

title: Delicious food and excellent wine
text: Went back after a couple of years and had another great experience. All the food was really delicious and the suggested wine was exquisite. Typical Portuguese dishes served with a home touch and cooked on the spot. This is a very small place, and they don’t take any reservations, so it is key to go early if you don’t want to wait. For sure one of my favorite places in Feira.

title: Definitely not a 5 stars hotel
text:
I have to start by saying that it is really difficult to accept this hotel as a 5 star one. It has been a huge disappointment having been in similar hotels in Porto. The pool should not be called a pool as we are talking about a 4x4 meters water tank. Having only four chairs to sit/lay down in the pool/sauna area tells it all about the space that is available. The bedrooms are another space that are not up to a 5 stars hotel. Small areas, no special features, very bad finishings, poor isolation on the windows, it seems like there was definitely a savings focus when building it. In fact, on the two nights we were there, in the passageway from the reception to the back building where the rooms are, it was dripping in the several places, with buckets on the corridor collecting the water.
The bar is at the same level. The octopus salad was more a lettuce salad with very few octopus. I know it was the daily snack dish, and it was only 5 euros, but again I was expecting more and a different approach. When we ordered a tea and we were presented with a tea bag which you can buy in any supermarket, there is not much you can do to defend it. Truly disappointing and therefore not returning.

title: Great food and concept
text: What an amazing night an Mini Bar. The concept is very interesting and the food was really inspirational. We decided to try the Taste Menu and every single dish was a nice surprise. The service was excellent and therefore a place to go back.

title: Nice way to spend a couple of hours
text: This was a well spend time for both kids and adults. The highlights were the opportunity to make your own chocolate and to watch several paintings from Munch in the canteen. You will get a handful of chocolates during the visit, which are delicious. Be aware that the tour guide is in Norwegian.

title: An amazing experience in the last night
text:
After following ABO on social media for some time, we decided to try to watch the Aurora Borealis and decided to come here. After 3 frustrating nights, as it was very cloudy and snowing, we had an amazing experience in our last night there. Our friend Aurora decided to give us an amazing show which we will remember for the rest of our lifes. Even being cold outside, we spend around 3 hours looking up in all directions. Bring clothing to be outside in freezing temperatures.
The breakfast is a cold one but with several different options, which was more than enought for adults and kids. The opportunity to have breakfast until 12.00 gives the opportunity to wake up later and have a much more relaxed stay.
Be aware that the site is still being developed, so there were some works going around, including some machinery noise.
There are daily shuttles to the nearest town for some shopping as you will need to cook in the apartments, as there is not other choice nearby. You will need to make some planning in advance, as not necessarily the shuttle is always available due to their tours around the island.

title: Get in and take a look at the Via Sacra representations
text: We were walking past the church and we decided to get in. Initially it seemed like it was closed, but the door was in fact open. It is a small catholic church, but was amazing to see that they have the mass information sheet in several different languages. There are 14 paintings containing Via Sacra representations, which was interesting to go through with the kids.

title: A great way to spend an hour or so away from the cold
text: We spent around 1h15m here, and there are no regrets about it. It is a small place but with interesting things for both adults and children. We were able to watch the seals being fed, watch a couple of movies, one about the Aurora Borealis and another about Svalbard, in between a couple of exposition rooms, and it was a worthy time. If you want to get away from the cold for some time, this is definitely a very good option.

title: Excellent Food, Setting and Price
text: This was a very good experience. We were a party of 7 people, and arrived around 12.00 and were the only customers in the restaurant. Not a very appealing situation but we decided to stay and that was the right decision. All the food we choose was very good, from the fish soup to the Triple Artic dish where we can try whale, reindeer and seal. The only downside is a lack of any specific child dishes, but we were able to find something to everybody. The place is an old fishing warehouse and it is a type of museum, and it was great to have the opportunity to spend some time taking a look at old objects used in the past. The location is also quite nice and very nice views. In the end a very attractive price, the bill came at 1200 nok for 7 people, drinking only water, which it is still a huge value for money in Norway. Really recommended.

title: Delicious food but not the perfect experience
text:
Decided to try this restaurant as it was closer to my hotel and based on TA reviews. Arrived around 20.00 on a Sunday and the restaurant was quite full.
While the person who took me to the table spoke to me in English, and there were menus in English, 3 waiters come to me and the moment I asked them if we could speak English they just disappeared. Eventually, and after some 10 minutes, there was a gentleman, who for sure was not a waiter, which came to me and took my order. Although I have ordered a salad as a starter, a bread based dish, and a Lamb stew as a main, the main dish and the salad came together and only some 20 minutes after I finished those two the bread based dish arrived. It was a quite strange situation as I have asked the waiter for the order of the dishes.
Although I was alone and therefore not talking with anyone, the music was slightly louder than I believe it should. But the most important thing is definitely the food, and all 3 dishes were delicious. Very good indeed. If I am alone I most likely will go back, not sure if I will be with someone else as I don’t think trying to chat on top of the music will be a pleasant experience.

title: Great non meat options
text: Lunch with work colleagues at 15.45 and therefore not a lot of people in the restaurant. Decided to go for non meat dishes and was pleased to realize that they have a lot of options. Order the Tomato Carpaccio and the Thai Soup and both were deliciously. Together with a coke the price came up around 1200 rubles. The waiter spoke a good English, there were menus in English and the food came quite fast. Therefore a place to go back for sure.

title: Daily menus provide a good option for a quick lunch
text: Went for lunch with some work colleagues and went for the Fish of the Day menu with risotto. Food didn’t take too long and was very tasty. Asked for a lemonade without sugar and was told that the only one was the ginger one, which was ok. The space is a nice one with a nice decoration. Definitely a good option for a quick lunch in a work day.

title: Imposing scenario
text: It is definitely an experience that you shall have if you are around. Entering the square you feel something different just by being in one of the most famous squares in the world. Just wander around for a while, have a seat and admire the architecture around the square. Take the opportunity to enter the shopping mall opposite to the Kremlin for something definitely different.

title: Excellent steak and service
text: Arrived with a couple of friends and as we didn’t have a reservation we were seated in a back room. That was a little bit disappointing as there is no atmosphere there. Although the positive side was that it was less noisy than in the main room. The food was excellent. The Machete steak was delicious and perfectly cooked. Both the pepper and cheese sauces were very very good. The service was great, as there was a waiter checking on us regularly and the food didn’t take too long. All in all a very nice experience and for sure will come back. Highly recommended.

title: An humble place with good food
text: Came here just because it was one of the closest restaurants to my hotel. It is a very humble place, good service and good enough food. Also a good value for money, with their many different menus options. There is no English menu, so be prepared to practice your French.

title: Good location but allrest average
text:
The only positive think is the location, all the rest is average. The price is consistent with the hotel, therefore it is not expensive. When I was doing my booking I realised that the price during the week was half than on the weekend.
There was only 1 lift working during the entire stay, and no sign or information about the other one not being operational. It is not difficult to find out after a couple of days... Honesty and transparency are values that you should aim for.
The breakfast is as expected quite average. One day there was a waffles machine available, but as the machine was doing only one waffle at a time, and at a rate of 2,5 minutes per waffle, with a queue of 5 or 6 people everytime, people need to wait 15/20 minutes for an opportunity. Make another machine available please, it wouldn't cost much...
The cleaning service of the rooms is definitely low standard. One day the cleaner came to our room, didn't clean the room, took the used towels, and didn't leave new ones. That was a first time.
The swimming pool is ok, and a good spot for the kids in the end of the day.
You can walk to the Universal Studios in around 3 minutes.
place: Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Orlando Resort & Suites Intl Drive

title: A lot of animals and birds, great for children
text:
A lot of animals and birds, the children loved it. The birds show was amazing with a couple of really strange animals which i have never saw before.
It was a hot day, but there are enough shadows around to escape the sun. That was a saturday and there were some activities in the internal "main square",with water, ice creams, different food and some gifts being available for free, which was very nice.
On a downside, although a small area, it is sometimes not easy to navigate around due to the lack of signs and the not so much useful map you are given in the entrance.
On a quite negative note, it is for difficult to understand why you need to pay the car parking. Be prepared to pay 10 USD for the car paking.
It were a well spend 3 to 4 hours. A very good option for kids.

title: Very unique atmosphere
text: Great sight even for me who are quite familiar with Domino. It reminded me my grandfather who was addicted to the game. For children this is also a unique experience, and it was great to see some of the players asking my kids to paricipate and help them. Probably the best spot in little havana, as you really have the chance to be part of a local experience. 15 minutes shall be enough to have a feeling about it, but you can spend more. Highly recommended.

title: Good walk and great architecture
text: We were to the Espanola Way in the morning, therefore it was quite calm and with very few people. Not even all the restaurants/cafes were open. Anyway, for a family with children, this was the right time of the year. It was a nice walk, an opportunity to take a look at the interesting architecture and a relaxed time. We didnæt spend more than 15 minutes there, walking to the one end and walk back. Take a look if you are around.

title: A great experience for all ages
text: If you don't smoke, as it is my case, this is definitely a great experience if you are in the area. Probably you don't need more than 15 minutes, if you want to go around and see all the different types of cigars, and where they are made. There is some local coffee available for free. Clearly a place to get in and spend some minutes.

title: A good option for children, an economic option with ok food
text: We were a fanily of 5 who decided to try Oraganatta while looking for an option to have dinner in the area. It is an all you can eat place, with options for salads, pastas, pizzas and desserts. The salada bar has an interesting variety, but the rest of the food is average, whcih of course is reflected in the price you pay. It is not expensive, and if you are with children, this is definitely something you should be looking at, if of course they like pizza and pasta.

title: Go for the tiles
text: This is an amazing place to go and admire the local daily living and the astonishing tiles all over the main hall. Even for young children this is a great experience. Just take half an hour of your day, you will not regret.

title: Very tasty tapas in a nice setting
text: This was a great choice. Food was excellent, really tasty, and the service quite quick. We ordered about 6/7 tapas for 2 people and it was enough food. We tried all the signature dishes and all of them were delicious. Definitely recommended and a place to go for a very nice time and gastronomic experience.

title: Excellent experience
text:
Having great expectations about The Yeatman I have to say that there were met but there were some details which shall not happen in such a quality hotel. When we arrived at the bedroom the AC was not working and the door to the varanda was not closing. Having called the reception both problems were sorted out immediately. The bedroom was great, very spacious and a nice king bed. The breakfast was one of the highlights of our stay with a lot of variety and delicious stuff. Ask for a table near the windows for amazing views. The spa and the indoor pool were very nice although the air temperature was slightly cold and was not comfortable to stay after leaving the pool. The gym has several machines and quite nice options. The location is good, we were able to walk to Porto downtown easily. Service was very efficient, and we were even able to check in earlier than usual as the room was available.
The hotel is like a museum, make sure you take a walk around all floors as they all have a theme with things to see. The same for the interior stairs between the floors with a great chronology of events.
All in all a very good stay.

title: Excellent location and very good breakfast
text: Coming from a much more expensive country, this is very good value for money. A very good bedroom, very clean, with a great breakfast, full of options, the smoothies were amazing, and an excellent location, close to the old town. There is a fitness room which I didn’t use. Low points were the slow check in and the crowd at breakfast, where it was not easy to find a table to sit.
place: Park Inn by Radisson Central Tallinn

title: Excellent dinner and experience
text:
What a great evening. Came here by luck, and although the restaurant was fully booked we were told than a table was becoming vacant in 10 minutes so we waited and what a great decision. The atmosphere is very nice and the service superb. Loreta took really good care of us and provided an excellent service. The food was very tasty, a simple fish soup, the risotto in the lamb was fantastic and the local cheeses were delicious. All together with a great wine selection resulted in a amazing evening and experience.
Definitely recommended and a place to come back for sure.

title: Simply Delicious
text: I have tried some Indian restaurants in Dunfermline and this has been the best food I got. Simply delicious food and efficient service. I tried the Lamb Garlic Chili with coconut rice and garlic naan, and everything was cooked in perfection. The naan was probably the best I ever ate. The lamb was fantastic. Definitely I will go back whenever I have the chance, and definitely recommended.

title: Impossible to turn off noisy AC but a great breakfast
text: Stayed here for one night and a mixed sensation about the place. The room was fine with enough space for a single person. The main problem courted when I wanted to turn off the AC as it was making some noise for me to sleep. After looking around for a way to turn it off without success, I called the reception to be told that it was not possible as the AC had a single system for the all building and could be turned off per room. I appreciate that it is not necessarily a problem for everybody, but it was for me who like to sleep with silence. On a positive note, the breakfast was really good, with different options from smoothies, natural orange juice, to the traditional British options. I had probably the best mushrooms I ever ate in an hotel. In summary, I am not sure if I will come back. Need to assess other local options and for sure check if they don’t have the same issue with the AC.

title: Average tapas with good service
text:
Visited on Monday night as part of a party of four and we were the only customers during the couple of hours we were there. Definitely November is a quiet time of the year. The service was efficient and polite. We ordered different tapas, meatballs, patatas bravas, the manchego cheese, chorizo, pardon peppers. For someone that has eaten tapas in several different places, and also in Spain, there is a clear benchmark and unfortunately these were not more than average. The pardon peppers were still less than that. The chorizo was too small, while on a positive note the meatballs were quite good.
The price was reasonable, I personally paid around 350 nok with a beer but without any dessert. All in all not positive enough to go back if I am around.

title: Quick, reasonable price and delicious
text:
Came taken by a colleague and been quite satisfied with the outcome. It was very quick to choose, ingredients were fresh, and the food very tasteful. I paid 16 USD for the dish and a coke, which was quite reasonable. All the service was quite efficient and quick.
Recommended.

title: Good food but a very noisy place
text: The first thing that comes to my mind about this place is how noisy it was. It was difficult to keep a conversation without raising the voice. The place was really full. The food was very good, tried the Chicharroms. The place was well decorated and the service was quite efficient. A good experience but not sure if I will repeat it.

title: Good caipirinha and all the rest average
text: The place has an interesting ambience and I was looking for eating some very good meat but my expectations were definitely not met. The quality and diversity of meat was very average. The caipirinha on another hand was a good one. The service was definitely average also, with one of the employees even basically refusing to acknowledge when asked a question. Anyway, all in all an experience which I will not repeat. Also because it is not cheap for what you get.

title: Typical delicious Spanish tapas
text:
We were a party of 4 who arrived there at 15.45, 15 minutes before closing and asked if we could still be served. The waiter/owner immediately said yes and we eventually only left almost at 17.00. We went for several tapas and all were greatly cooked and delicious. This is a small place but full of character and with true food.
The price is really value for money, highly recommended if you are looking for a tapas place.

title: Delicious Mexican food
text: Probably the best Mexican food I ever ate. If you like this type of food or would like to try it, this is definitely a place to go. From the moment you get in you really feel like you are in a special place. The service was personal and attentive, but the food was definitely the highlight. Highly recommended.

title: A delicious experience
text:
This was indeed an amazing experience. All the food was really delicious. The flavor and presentation were exquisite of all the 5 dishes I tried. The service was very efficient and the price not expensive for the food and experience. The dishes were brought one by one which allowed to really take the time to try and taste them.
Highly recommended.

title: A great place for tapas
text:
Arrived here on a Monday night around 21.30 and it was half full.
Decided to stay inside on a more interesting setting. The tables outside are really close to the street.
All the tapas were excellent, specially the pork cheeks which melted in the mouth. The beer was good, and overall a very good experience.
Definitely recommended.

title: Very average beef
text:
Decided to come here as the restaurant we were planning to go was closed. Mainly decided to get in because of the football being shown in the big screen.
We were 4 and decided to share two 1 kg beef steaks.
The meat was very average, it is announced as organic meat, but really doubt that.
The rest was irrelevant due to the lack quality of food.
Not to go back again.

title: An excellent meal, all food delicious
text:
This was an incredible experience, filled with delicious food. From the starters, which included marinated salty cod fish, to the dessert, Catalan crema, through the main dish, roasted lamb leg, everything was finely cooked.
The service was superb and very attentive.
As the restaurant doesn’t even have a place on its own to review, I really consider this as an hidden gem.
The decoration and setting is also quite special and for sure this is a place where you can try the real Spanish and Catalan cuisine.
Truly recommended.

title: A good experience and location
text:
It was a good experience staying at AC. The room was good, the staff friendly and the location is quite good, although you will need to walk around 15 minutes to reach the old town.
There is a small fitness room which was good enough to do some light exercise. There was towels and bottles of water available.
The breakfast was very good with natural juices and a good variety of fruit, and cheeses.
Most likely will stay here again.

title: Not an ordinary experience with delicious food
text:
I was very surprised when I got in at Bundobust as it didn’t seem at all an Indian restaurant. When I realized I could not order at the table but had to go to the counter I was quite suspicious. Arrived there around 2pm and there was only a handful of tables with people, which didn’t help my confidence.
Everything changed when I started eating the delicious food. Not big portions but enough to become very satisfied. I ordered one of the combos for 7 £ and it is definitely amazing value for money.
Great food, cheap, efficient service and on an interesting setting, therefore a place to go back for sure. Congratulations on the model.

title: Great value for money and excellent location
text:
Decided to stay here on my 3 night stay in Manchester because it was close to the Piccadilly Station. The location is excellent, within 10/15 walk you are at the University, Spinningfields, Northern Quarter, Deansgate, and even walkable to the Man City stadium.
The price is quite competitive, and for a low cost chain, the value for money was excellent.
The room was of a decent size, the bathroom quite spacious, with very modern decoration. Breakfast is normal, but enough.
All in all, a great experience, and definitely a place I will most likely choose again next time I am in MAN.

title: Excellent atmosphere
text: Went here to meet with a group of friends and when arrived around 6pm the place was already very busy and there were no tables available. The atmosphere was excellent and it was a great place to have some drinks while chatting. The only down was that when people started to get hungry and wanted to eat something we were told that we could not order food without being on a table. As there were no tables available we eventually had to leave and eat in a restaurant next door. Which by the way was an excellent decision, the best meal I had in Manchester.

title: Excellent brunch, worth the wait to order
text:
Arrived just before 11.00 on Sunday and it was quite busy. You will need to queue to make your order at the counter. That can take some 10
minutes, but the food will arrive quite quick which will compensate.
I order a Mighty Green smoothie and a brunch of smashed avocado with egg and salmon. All was delicious and well cooked. There are several options and you can even combine stuff as your preference. The atmosphere is very informal and full of young people.
Clearly although was busy, people didn’t need to wait too long for a table.
Definitely a great place for brunch.

title: Great range of music and enough space for all
text:
Although this is not a big area, on a Saturday night it was definitely not busy. We were a group of around 15 people and we were happy to realize that we had enough space for our party. The music was great, ranging from indie manchester songs (Stone Roses, Oasis, James) to more main stream ones.
Didn’t try any cocktails, but the prices seem reasonable, al least for the gin tonic.
The toilets could be better cared, but this is a basement bar with I guess not much space to extend.
All in all a great night.

title: Honest food and efficient service
text:
Arrived with a friend at around 20.00 on an Thursday night to find being the only people eating there.
Therefore very quite.
I didn’t know what think as first impression. The decor is a little bit tired, but it also gives some genuineness to the place.
The food was good without being great, but definitely honest food. The service was very efficient since we arrived until we left, with the waiter suggesting some dishes and the food came quite quick.
A nice experience.

title: Excellent atmosphere for a drink before dinner
text:
Me and a friend arrived at 17.00 and the place was buzzing. We were just going for a drink before having dinner somewhere else. Although quite busy it was not difficult to find a couple of high chairs in the counter to sit. They have a broad range of beers to choose, as well as other drinks. It was a nice stay, music was not loud, although busy it was easy to talk and have a conversation. We left after 18.00 and it continued full.
A place to go again for sure.

title: Typical Portuguese restaurant with honest Portuguese food
text:
If you are looking for a place to eat in this town, Cerca is definitely one place to try.
Honest food, well cooked in a traditional way, big portions at a reasonable price.
The service is not great but well enough, and as expected from Portuguese people, nice and gracious.
For sure you should try some desserts. For our party of 6 the waiter suggested to bring a sample of everything that was available and it was fantastic.
Definitely recommended.

title: A great and intensive experience
text:
You don’t need to spend much more than one hour in Castelo Rodrigo, but walking around the walls and the stony houses is an amazing experience. Every step, every look, you are just lost in the medieval ages.
This is a place to visit and revisit several times as although a small place, it seems like there is so much to see and feel.
Don’t hesitate to go and enjoy the moment.

title: Great and pure Portuguese food in a local atmosphere
text:
Was planning to have lunch at the Abadia but it was closed.
As we were a party of 10 hungry people, I decided to check this restaurant which was just next door. As I came in I immediately realized it was a safe place to eat as it was completely full of local people. We had to wait for about 20 minutes for a table but the staff was flexible enough to allow us to choose and make our order while we were waiting. When the food came, it was the proof of why it was full of local people. Simply great and typical Portuguese food. We ordered different dishes and they were all amazing well cooked: Tripas, Polvo (octopus), Sardines and Bacalhau á Braga.
It is definitely a place to go if you want to be in a true Portuguese restaurant, with a typical Portuguese service and delicious Portuguese food.
Will go back for sure.
Definitely recommended.

title: Excellent service, great starters, average main dishes
text:
Starting with the less positive part of the meal, our main dishes were average. The francesinha was just ok, difficult to compete with other places in Feira for francesinhas. My wife ordered a steak, which didn’t have any sauce at all as expected from a cervejaria. The starters were very good, quite delicious, and the service outstanding which was enough to get them a 4 stars.
I will probably give them another chance, but definitely for a francesinha there are other better places to go.

title: Excellent view and great space for a night drink
text:
I went there with some friends after having dinner in a restaurant nearby. We went to the rooftop bar for a drink and although it was a little bit chill it was a great time. The view is amazing, there was enough space to sit and not very noisy.
The barman was very engaging suggesting some drinks.
After all, a great experience.
The restaurant and the inside bar downstairs were quite full but still comfortable to be in a very interesting atmosphere and nice decoration.

title: Most horrible service ever
text:
I will start by saying that the food was good, but that it is not enough when all the rest is pretty horrible.
The service was basically non existent. At a certain point when we were almost finishing eating our food, we were still waiting for the drinks.
That completely killed the dinner as we were eating some spicy food.
The waiter told us that there was a lot of work in the bar, but the restaurant was not even full, therefore if you are not prepared to have a level of service enough to serve drinks in due time, you better go and do something else.
The place has huge potential, but definitely not with this type of service.
Will not go back to try again for sure.
